title.narrative: Aid to drought affected communities in Somali/Ethiopia

description.narrative:
Ethiopia is facing a complex humanitarian crisis as a result of an ongoing drought combined with an ethno-political conflict, leaving 8,5M people in need of humanitarian assistance, with the eastern part of Ethiopia Somali region being hardest hit. In response, ICCO & Kerk in Actie/ACT Alliance (ICCO&KiA/ACT) plans to provide live-saving humanitarian assistance that focuses on the priority sectors of Food Security and Water Supply in Eastern Jarar in Somali region.
The goal of the program of ICCO&KiA/ACT is to save lives and reduce morbidity related to drought and conflict of 10,000 drought affected (agro-)pastoralists community members and IDPs in Eastern Jarar, in 4 targeted districts: Habuura, Haye, Yacub-Boole, and Haye-Weyne. Key result 1: Improving food security status of 5,000 people (1,000 HHs) Through emergency food assistance to 1000 most vulnerable HHs with the complete country food basket (derived from Sphere guidelines): 15kg maize, 0.5liter vegetable oil, and 5kg supplementary food (famix 5%), and 1.5 kg pulses per person for 6 months. The HHs also benefit from Wash interventions. Key result 2: Improving access to safe drinking water and reducing morbidity for 10,000 people (2,000 HHs) Through distribution of water purification tablets during 6 months to increase acute access to water, treatment and maintenance of 20 water schemes for future drought resilience, and hygiene awareness promotion.

In response to the drought in Somali region in Ethiopia, ICCO & Kerk in Actie/ACT Alliance provides live-saving humanitarian assistance that focuses on the priority sectors of Food Security and Water Supply in Eastern Jarar in Somali region. The goal of the program of ICCO&KiA/ACT is to save lives and reduce morbidity related to drought and conflict of 10,000 drought affected (agro-)pastoralists community members and IDPs in Eastern Jarar, in 4 targeted districts.
With ACT partner Ethiopian Evangelical Church Mekane Yesus (EECMY)

participating-org.narrative: The Ethiopian Evangelical Church Mekane Yesus Dvt and Social

activity-description.narrative: Food distribution and water rehabilitation will take place

receiver-org.narrative: The Ethiopian Evangelical Church Mekane Yesus Dvt and Social
The Ethiopian Evangelical Church Mekane Yesus Dvt and Social
The Ethiopian Evangelical Church Mekane Yesus Dvt and Social

title.narrative: Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities

comment.narrative: Community representatives are identified and trained on hygiene and sanitation

As of 31/12/18: Since water availability was much better than at planning stage, there was a need to limit the WASH component (and increasing the food security component). Trainings on sanitation and hygiene were provided to wash and relief committees in both sites. Furthermore, in Bulale they were trained on how to manage the water schemes.

title.narrative: Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use

comment.narrative: Rehabilitation and maintenance of 20 water schemes (birkas, ponds, etc.), incl distributino of water purification tablet

As of 31/12/18: Since water availability was much better than at planning stage, there was a need to limit the WASH component (and increasing the food security component). In the end 3 hand-dug wells were created in Bulale kebele, and ten items of (10.000 liter capacity) plastic water tanks (fiberglass) were supplied in 'Koloji' IDP camp. This made realization of beneficiaries less than planned

title.narrative: Number of people enabled to meet their basic food needs

comment.narrative: Complete country food basket for 6 months

As of 31/12/18: After further consultations with the target communities, the food items were changed from maize to a combination of wheat flour (10 kg/person/month) & rice (5kg/person/month) since this corresponded better to the food habits of the communities, although these food items are more expensive. Therefore less beneficiaries reached than planned (although over 80% of planned still)
Complete country food basket for 6 months
